p: A. cantoniensis is a Chinese folk medicine and vegetable (Hance); the isolated polysaccharide fractions of which showed significant immunomodulation and antitumor properties. The fraction activated lymphocyte proliferation, stimulated the production NO of peritoneal macrophages, and exhibited inhibitory effects on the migration of MCF-7 cells ( 177). The whole plant showed considerable wound-healing capacity at a concentration of 5% (v/w) as evidenced by increased wound contraction, hydroxyproline content, and decreased epithelialization time compared with control ( 178).
